question: What is an online doctor consultation or online medical consultation?
answer: When you speak to a doctor about your health concerns through an audio/video/ chat, it is known as an online doctor consultation or online medical consultation. This is a good alternative for times when you cannot visit a doctor physically at the clinic or hospital. An online doctor consultation works the same way as a physical consultation where you get a doctors note after the consultation is complete. Some of the benefits of an online medical consultation at Apollo 24/7 are that you can consult a doctor at the convenience of your home and can order the prescribed medicines by using the Order Medicines option.

question: How do I consult a doctor online now?
answer:
You can book an online consultation either on the website or mobile app of Apollo 24/7 in two ways.

Click on the ‘Find a Doctor’ button on the homepage of the website/app, select a specialty or type the name of the doctor directly. Once you select a doctor, you can click on the “Consult Now’ button to start the online consultation.

If you're looking for a doctor based on your symptoms, you may start by going to the homepage of the website/app. Then click on the ‘Track Symptoms’ tab, search for your symptoms or select a few of them based on your health condition. Click ‘Show Doctors’, select a doctor and click on the ‘Consult Now’ button to start the online consultation.

question: Do you provide online doctor consultation for emergencies?
answer: No. We do not recommend or provide online consultations for emergencies. However, our emergency medical services are available round-the-clock which can be accessed by calling 1066 or clicking the ‘Emergency’ tab on the homepage of our website/app.

question: During the online doctor consultation, the audio/video was not clear.
answer: This may happen due to poor internet connectivity or due to some technical glitch. In such cases, please check your internet connection and if the issue persists, please email us at helpdesk@apollo247.com with the screenshot of the error and we will get this checked from our end.

question: What is the minimum fee for online doctor consultation?
answer: Online doctor consultation at Apollo 24/7 starts at Rs.200. The consultation fee will vary based on the doctor, the specialty, years of experience of the doctor, any discounts or promotion applied, etc.

question: How do I pay for the online/offline doctor consultations?
answer: Online consultations are prepaid and the payment can be made by either of the given ways – Paytm, Debit/Credit Card, and Netbanking. For offline consultations, you will need to make a partial payment online and the rest can be paid to the doctor at the hospital/clinic

question: Will I get a refund if I cancel the online doctor consultation?
answer: Yes. If you cancel the online consultation, the refund for the same will reflect in your account within 5 to 7 working days.

question: What is a specialist doctor?
answer: A doctor who has done a specialization/training in a specific area of medicine after completing his/her M.B.B.S degree is known as a specialist doctor. He/she can treat complex health issues which a primary doctor may be unable to.

question: When should you consult a specialist doctor?
answer: If your health concern is complex and your physician feels that it needs the attention of a specialised doctor, you will be referred to one. You can also consult a specialist doctor if you aren’t satisfied with the treatment/results of your primary doctor, you are struggling with a condition that is not improving, you have been diagnosed with a complex chronic condition, etc.

question: Why is it best to consult a specialist doctor?
answer: A specialist doctor is trained to treat complex health conditions which your primary doctor may not be able to. Hence, if you are diagnosed with a complex chronic condition, it is best that you consult a specialist doctor. However, for other normal and generic health conditions, you can visit a primary doctor.

question: How do I book an online appointment with a specialist doctor in advance for tomorrow or later?
answer: To book an online appointment with a specialist doctor, you can select the speciality from the displayed list or type in the name of the speciality. Once you select the speciality, you will be shown a list of doctors and their availability. If you wish to book an online appointment for a later time, you can choose the doctors that have ‘Consult Tomorrow’ or ‘Consult in 2 days’, ‘Consult in 3 days,’ etc. You can also choose the ‘Schedule for Later’ option after selecting the doctor and clicking on the ‘Consult Now’ button.

question: For how long can I speak to the doctor?
answer: Once you book an online consultation on our app, you will get 15 minutes to speak to the doctor. This window can, however, change according to your health condition and the number of queries you have.

question: How do I book a follow-up session with the same doctor on the app?
answer: To book a follow-up session with the same doctor, select the ‘Active Appointments’ tab on the home page or ‘Appointments’ tab on the bottom menu bar of the app. After that, you can click on the ‘Schedule A Follow-Up’ button to book a follow-up consultation. Alternatively, you can also go to ‘Health Records’ section on the app, select ‘Consults & Rx’, select the appointment card and click on the ‘Schedule A Follow-Up’ button.

question: Will my online consultation be covered in my health insurance?
answer: To know if your online consultation is covered in your health insurance policy, you will need to get in touch with your insurance provider. They will be able to guide you on the same.

question: What happens if my call gets disconnected during the consultation?
answer: If your audio/video call gets disconnected during the online consultation, you would receive another call within a few minutes provided your internet connection is stable.

question: Where do I find the chat option?
answer: After you've booked an online consultation, you can go to the ‘Appointments’ tab, select the ‘Active Appointments’ tab and click on the appointment card. Then click on the ‘Prepare for Consult’ tab. You will be directed to a chat window. Fill in the required details, and you're all set to be consulted by a doctor at your selected time

question: Why have I not received a response from the doctor?
answer: Though a rarity, this may happen sometimes if your doctor is busy but there is no need to worry. Your appointment will get rescheduled automatically for the next available slot.

question: How do I claim a refund if I am not satisfied with the consultation?
answer: If for some reasons, you are unsatisfied with the quality of the consultation, you can claim for a refund by emailing us at helpdesk@apollo247.com.

question: I missed the consultation call from the doctor. What do I do now?
answer: If you've missed a call from the doctor, you can go to the chat window and request a call by simply chatting with the doctor. In case the doctor is unavailable, you can reschedule the consultation. If you aren't happy with the date and timings, you can email us at helpdesk@apollo247.com, and we'll get back to you in no time with a better solution.

question: How do I order medicines on Apollo 24/7 using an e-prescription/physical prescription?
answer:
You can order medicines on Apollo 24/7 by either of the below-given ways

E-Prescription

Get an online consultation with the required specialist

You'll get an e-prescription after a successful consultation in the chat room

On the e-prescription, click on the ‘Order Meds & Tests’ tab

The prescribed medicines will be added to your cart

Place the order by selecting/entering your address and payment method of choice.

Prescription Document

Take a clear picture of the prescription

Go to the ‘Buy Medicine’ section, select the ‘Upload Prescription’ tab and click ‘Choose from Gallery’

Then choose a delivery address and click on the ‘Submit Prescription’ tab

Your prescription will be verified at the backend and the medicines will accordingly be added to your cart.

If there is any confusion related to your prescription, you will receive a call from our pharmacy team for clarification.

You can also, go to Medicine and select Upload Prescription and click Take a Photo.

question: Can I order medicines without a prescription?
answer: Any medicine that is marked ‘Rx’ on our platform (website, app), require a prescription without which it will not be dispensed. If you do not have a prescription but wish to purchase the ‘Rx’ marked medicines, you can click on the ‘Consult A Doctor’ tab to consult and obtain a prescription. Once you have the prescription, you can directly purchase medicines from Apollo 24/7 by clicking on the ‘Order Meds & Tests’ tab. Please note that you do not need a prescription to buy over-the-counter (OTC) medicines.

question: How do I know if my prescription is valid?
answer: As per government regulations, any prescription that contains the details of the doctor, patient, medicine, prescription date, and doctor’s sign/stamp is valid up to 6 months from the date of issue.

question: Will I get an invoice if I order medicines on Apollo 24/7?
answer:
After buying your medicines or any healthcare products in general, you will be provided with an invoice only at the time of delivery by the assigned delivery agent. However, you can check your order summary in the app/website by following the given steps.

a) Click on ‘Buy Medicines’ tab on the homepage

b) Select ‘My Orders’ tab

c) You will see the list of all the orders placed by you

d) Select the order for which you wish to see the invoice summary

e) Click on the ‘Order Summary’ tab to view the invoice

question: How do I cancel my medicine order?
answer:
You can cancel your order by following the below-given steps –

Visit the ‘Buy Medicines’ tab on the homepage and click on ‘My Orders’

Select any recent order, and you’ll be directed to the order page

Click Vertical Icon (⁞) and then on the ‘Cancel Order’ tab.

A dialogue box will appear on the screen.

Select a reason for your cancellation and click on the ‘Submit Request’ button.

question: When will I receive my order?
answer: For any update on your order such as delivery date and time, you can get in touch with our customer service at 1860-500-0101 or email us at onlinehelpdesk@apollopharmacy.org with your order details.

question: How can I pay for my order?
answer: You can pay for your medicine orders by any one of the given ways – Debit/Credit Card, Netbanking, Paytm Wallet, UPI, and Cash on Delivery (COD).

question: Can I reschedule my order?
answer: Absolutely! To reschedule your order, you can call our helpline number at 1860-500-0101.

question: How do I track my order?
answer: To track your order, just click on ‘Buy Medicines’ followed by ‘My Orders’. Then select the order and click on ‘Track Order’. The status of your order will be shown to you.

question: Can I use prescriptions other than Apollo’s to order medicines from Apollo 24/7?
answer: Definitely! You can use the ‘Upload Prescription’ option to upload prescriptions from other service providers other than Apollo 24/7 and purchase medicines.

question: How do I download my e-prescription?
answer: To download your e-prescription generated during an online consultation, use the download button denoted by the symbol (↓).

question: How do I upload a prescription?
answer: You can upload a prescription either by clicking on the ‘Buy Medicines’ or ‘Health Records’ tab. Under both these tabs, you will find the ‘Upload Prescription’ button.

question: What long is my prescription valid for?
answer: Prescriptions are valid for 6 months from the date of issue.

question: Why was my prescription rejected?
answer:
Your prescriptions can be rejected due to the following reasons:

Prescription has passed its validity date (6 months from date of issue)

The picture of the prescription is unclear.

question: Why is my order delayed?
answer: Your order may be delayed due to a number of reasons such as stock unavailability, shortage of staff, higher demand, etc. If you wish to find out the exact reason for the delay, you can get in touch with our customer service at onlinehelpdesk@apollopharmacy.org.

question: Some of my medicines are missing from my order. What should I do?
answer: Reach out to us at onlinehelpdesk@apollopharmacy.org with the pictures of all the items you received along with the invoice and we will get it checked from our end.

question: The medicines I received from Apollo 24/7 are damaged. What do I do now?
answer: Don’t worry! Just get in touch with us at onlinehelpdesk@apollopharmacy.org with the images of the damaged products and we will ensure that you receive a replacement or a refund for the same.

question: Whom should I contact if I have any payment related issues?
answer: You can email us at onlinehelpdesk@apollopharmacy.org for any issues you face with the payment.

question: Are my health records safe and secure?
answer: Absolutely! Your health records can only be viewed by you and will never be shared by any third party. You can read our Privacy Policy to know more.

question: Who can view my health records?
answer: Your health records can only be viewed by you. However, you do have an option to share your health records with the doctor in the course of online or physical consultation.

question: How do I book a diagnostic test on Apollo 24/7?
answer: To book a test on Apollo 24/7, click on the ‘Order Tests’ section on the website/app, select the test, and click on ‘Add to Cart’. Then go to the cart and choose either ‘Home Visit’ or ‘Clinic Visit’ and click on ‘Proceed to Payment. Please note that currently all the tests booked on Apollo 24/7 will be Cash on Delivery (COD).

question: Can I cancel a test that I have booked and how do I do it?
answer: If you wish to cancel a test, you will need to either email us at helpdesk@apollo247.com or call us at 04033442424.

question: How do I reschedule a test?
answer: You will need to follow the same procedure as of cancelling a test to reschedule a test book on Apollo 24/7. This means that you will need to either email us at helpdesk@apollo247.com or call us at 04033442424.

question: Can I take a diagnostic test at home?
answer: Yes, you can choose the ‘Home Visit’ option to take a diagnostic test at home. When you choose this option, a phlebotomist or a lab specialist will visit your home to collect your sample. However, not all tests can be done at home and for those tests, you will need to visit the nearest Apollo diagnostic centre.

question: Will my health insurance cover the tests that I book on Apollo 24/7?
answer: To find out if diagnostic tests are covered under your health insurance policy, it would be best to get in touch with your insurance provider. They will be able to provide you a better clarity.

question: Do I need to fast before I take a test?
answer: This will depend on the type of test you are taking. The pre-requisite of a test will be mentioned on the test details on the app.

question: How soon will I get the test results?
answer: It takes between 24 to 48 hours to generate the test results, although in few specific tests it might take longer time also.

question: Will my test reports be delivered to me?
answer: Your test results will be available on the Apollo 24/7 app or website under the ‘Health Records’ section after 24 - 48 hours. To access your test results, you will need to sign in to your account. Please note that the results of some tests may take longer than 48 hours.

question: Can I consult a doctor after I get my test results?
answer: Yes. Once your test results are generated and are available under your ‘Health Records’, you can book a consultation with a doctor on the Apollo 24/7 platform by clicking on the ‘Consult A Doctor’ button. If you wish to use the test results to consult a doctor apart from that of Apollo, you can do so by downloading the test results on your device.

question: Can I share my test reports with the doctor while doing an online consultation?
answer: Definitely! You can easily share images/files while doing an online consultation. There is a plus sign (+) on the bottom left. You can click (+) and attach images/files as per your wish. Please note that you can share the attachments in a PDF, JPG, or PNG format up to 2Mb only. You can share the attachments during your current online consultation or after a successful consultation for up to six days only.

question: Can I use the test reports for offline consultations as well?
answer: Yes, you can. For offline consultations you can use the downloaded version of the test reports.

question: Will other clinics/doctors/hospitals accept the test reports given by Apollo 24/7?
answer: Yes, the test results of Apollo 24/7 are valid and will be accepted by any clinic/hospitals and doctors other than that of Apollo’s.

question: What should I do if I haven’t received my test results?
answer: Test results may take up to 48 hours to be generated. If you do not receive the test report after 48 hours, you can write to us at helpdesk@apollo247.com or call us at 04033442424.

question: My home sample collection has been delayed. What do I do now?
answer: If, for some reason your home sample collection has been delayed, please reach out to us at 04033442424 or mail us at helpdesk@apollo247.com.

question: Do you accept online payments for booking diagnostic tests?
answer: We are sorry but at the moment, we accept only Cash On Delivery (COD) orders. You can however, pay by debit or credit card when the phlebotomist visits you for home sample collection.

question: How do I book an appointment at Apollo Clinic?
answer:
You can
a) Call our Customer Care number: 1860 500 7788
b) WhatsApp to 7066028648 c) Or log on to www.apolloclinic.com and request an appointment
d) Or directly walk in to the nearest Apollo Clinic

question: What are the working hours? Are you open on Sundays?
answer: To make it convenient for you, your neighbourhood Apollo Clinic is open from 8 AM to 8 PM. We work on Sundays also, for more detail please call 1860 500 7788

question: what are the services available in apollo clinic?
answer: Every Apollo Clinic offer Consultations for infants, children, adolescents, women, men and senior citizens. We also offer Lab Tests, Health Checks, Vaccinations, Dental services and Diabetes care. There is an Apollo Family Doctor at every centre and a treatment room that caters to medical requirements which includes minor procedures.

question: Are the doctors available round the clock for offline consultation?
answer: No, the doctors are available as per pre-determined consultation hours. The relevant information can be checked from apolloclinic.com or our Call Centre 1860 500 7788.
